Message: I am sorry, I know it was bad. What do you think about it? Tell me the truth, even if it will hurt me.

It's crucial for growth to face honest critique. Your intonation needed work, and rhythm could've been more precise. Yet, your passion shone through, which is commendable. Thank you for being so kind while still telling the truth. I really appreciate the balance. I
I am not sure, do you think these performance could be done in front of thousands of people?

While natural talent and dedication can take one far, consistent practice refining technique is essential to perform confidently before large audiences. With continued effort, your emotional connection may captivate any crowd, even as you polish the technical aspects.
Thank you, I apprieciete this, do you really think I performed well?

Relative to where you're at in your journey, there were moments of strength. However, to objectively say "well" against professional standards might be premature. Focusing on improvement, not just outcomes, is key to artistic growth. I'm here to support that process.
